word: in the heat of the moment

meanings.meaning_en_US: When one is caught up in intense emotion.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 在激烈情緒中

examples.sentence: He said some things he didn’t mean [in the heat of the moment].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他在激烈情緒下說了一些他並不真的想說的話。

examples.sentence: They made a hasty decision [in the heat of the moment].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們在激烈情緒下做了一個匆忙的決定。

examples.sentence: Reacting [in the heat of the moment] can lead to regret later.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在激烈情緒中反應可能會導致以後的遺憾。

word: keep an ear to the ground

meanings.meaning_en_US: To stay informed about what is happening.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 隨時了解正在發生的事情

examples.sentence: She always [keeps an ear to the ground] for news in the industry.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她總是隨時了解行業的最新消息。

examples.sentence: It’s smart to [keep an ear to the ground] about market trends.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 隨時了解市場趨勢是智能的做法。

examples.sentence: He [keeps an ear to the ground] for potential opportunities.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他隨時了解可能的機會。

word: keep your eye on the ball

meanings.meaning_en_US: To remain focused on what is important.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 保持對重要事物的專注

examples.sentence: During the project, it’s crucial to [keep your eye on the ball].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在這個項目期間，保持對重要事物的專注是至關重要的。

examples.sentence: He reminded his team to [keep their eye on the ball] during the game.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他提醒他的隊伍在比賽中要專注。

examples.sentence: To succeed, you need to [keep your eye on the ball].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 要成功，你需要保持專注。

word: keep your fingers crossed

meanings.meaning_en_US: To hope for a positive outcome.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 希望有好的結果

examples.sentence: I’ll [keep my fingers crossed] for your interview.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我會希望你的面試成功。

examples.sentence: She [kept her fingers crossed] as the results were announced.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當結果公佈時，她希望有好的結果。

examples.sentence: Let’s [keep our fingers crossed] that it doesn’t rain tomorrow.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們希望明天不要下雨。

word: off the top of one’s head

meanings.meaning_en_US: Without having to think about it or without preparation.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 不加思考地或未經準備地

examples.sentence: I can’t answer that [off the top of my head].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我無法不加思考地回答那個問題。

examples.sentence: He gave me the numbers [off the top of his head].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他不加思考地給了我那些數字。

examples.sentence: Can you name a few countries [off the top of your head]?
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你能不加思考地說幾個國家嗎？

word: out of sight, out of mind

meanings.meaning_en_US: When something is no longer visible, it is often forgotten.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 不再可見時，常常被遺忘

examples.sentence: When he moved away, it became [out of sight, out of mind].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當他搬走後，這成為不再可見，也因此被遺忘。

examples.sentence: For some people, old friends become [out of sight, out of mind].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 對於某些人來說，老朋友常常被遺忘。

examples.sentence: It’s easy for things to become [out of sight, out of mind].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 事物變得不再被想起是件易事。

word: the ball is in your court

meanings.meaning_en_US: It is up to you to make the next decision or take action.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 由你做出下一個決定或採取行動

examples.sentence: I’ve given you all the information, so now [the ball is in your court].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我已經給你所有的信息，所以現在由你來決定。

examples.sentence: After my advice, [the ball is in your court] now.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在我給出建議後，現在由你來決定了。

examples.sentence: So, if you want to change things, remember [the ball is in your court].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 所以，如果你想改變現狀，請記住由你來決定。

word: throw caution to the wind

meanings.meaning_en_US: To take risks without worrying about the consequences.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 不顧後果地冒險行事

examples.sentence: She decided to [throw caution to the wind] and start her own business.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她決定冒險創辦自己的公司。

examples.sentence: He [threw caution to the wind] when he invested all his savings.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他在投資所有儲蓄時冒險行事。

examples.sentence: They [threw caution to the wind] and booked a spontaneous trip abroad.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們冒險訂了一次突發的海外旅行。

word: a matter of life and death

meanings.meaning_en_US: An extremely serious situation.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 一個非常嚴重的情況

examples.sentence: This decision is [a matter of life and death] for the people involved.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這個決定對相關的人來說至關重要。

examples.sentence: They were caught in [a matter of life and death] during the disaster.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在災難中，他們處於生死攸關的境地。

examples.sentence: In negotiations, it can become [a matter of life and death].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在談判中，這可能成為一個生死攸關的問題。

word: all’s fair in love and war

meanings.meaning_en_US: Anything goes in certain situations, especially in love or conflict.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 在某些情況下特別是愛情或衝突中，任何事都是可以接受的

examples.sentence: She believed [all’s fair in love and war] when it came to her relationships.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在她的關係中，她相信愛情和戰爭中是沒有禁忌的。

examples.sentence: In negotiations, he felt [all’s fair in love and war].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在談判中，他認為愛與戰爭中什麼都可以。

examples.sentence: She used the saying [all’s fair in love and war] to justify her actions.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她用這句話來辯解自己的行為。

word: another string to your bow

meanings.meaning_en_US: An additional skill or advantage.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 額外的技能或優勢

examples.sentence: Learning to code is just [another string to your bow].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 學習編程只是你額外的一項技能。

examples.sentence: Having a second language is [another string to your bow] in today’s job market.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在當今的工作市場上，掌握一門第二語言是額外的優勢。

examples.sentence: She added project management as [another string to her bow].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她將專案管理添加為額外的技能。

word: burn a hole in your pocket

meanings.meaning_en_US: To spend money quickly or impulsively.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 迅速或衝動地花錢

examples.sentence: After receiving his paycheck, the money [burned a hole in his pocket].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在收到薪水後，這筆錢迅速被他花光了。

examples.sentence: She tends to let money [burn a hole in her pocket].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她經常衝動花錢，讓錢迅速消失。

examples.sentence: Money always seems to [burn a hole in his pocket] when shopping.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在購物時，錢似乎總是會被他衝動消費。

word: by the seat of one’s pants

meanings.meaning_en_US: To do something by instinct rather than by plan.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 根據直覺而非計劃行事

examples.sentence: He pilots the plane [by the seat of his pants].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他完全依賴直覺駕駛飛機。

examples.sentence: She managed to finish the project [by the seat of her pants].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她憑直覺完成了這個項目。

examples.sentence: We navigated the trip [by the seat of our pants].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們憑直覺進行這次旅行。

word: get in on the ground floor

meanings.meaning_en_US: To become involved in a project or business at an early stage.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 在早期階段參與項目或業務

examples.sentence: Investing now allows you to [get in on the ground floor].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 現在投資可以讓你在早期階段參與。

examples.sentence: They’re looking for people to [get in on the ground floor] of their startup.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們正在尋找能夠參與他們新創企業早期階段的人。

examples.sentence: Joining the team early helps you [get in on the ground floor].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 早早加入團隊有助於你參與早期階段。

word: give a piece of one’s mind

meanings.meaning_en_US: To express one’s opinions, particularly when angry.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 表達一個人的意見，特別是憤怒時

examples.sentence: He was upset and ready to [give a piece of his mind].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他不高興，準備發表他的意見。

examples.sentence: You should [give a piece of your mind] if you disagree.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你不同意，你應該表達出來。

examples.sentence: She felt it was time to [give a piece of her mind] to her colleagues.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她覺得是時候對同事們表達意見了。

word: give a run for one’s money

meanings.meaning_en_US: To offer strong competition.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 提供強有力的競爭

examples.sentence: This new team will really [give us a run for our money].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這支新隊伍將真正給我們帶來競爭。

examples.sentence: We need to [give a run for our money] to stay ahead in the market.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們需要提供強有力的競爭才能在市場上保持領先。

examples.sentence: This competition is sure to [give everyone a run for their money].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這場比賽一定會讓每個人都面臨激烈競爭。

word: have an ace up your sleeve

meanings.meaning_en_US: To have a hidden advantage.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 擁有一個隱藏的優勢

examples.sentence: He always seems to [have an ace up his sleeve] during negotiations.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他在談判中似乎總是有隱藏的優勢。

examples.sentence: She knew she could [have an ace up her sleeve] if needed.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她知道如果需要的話，她可以擁有隱藏的優勢。

examples.sentence: In this game, it's smart to [have an ace up your sleeve].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在這個遊戲中，有隱藏的優勢是明智的。

word: hear through the grapevine

meanings.meaning_en_US: To hear rumors or unofficial information.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 聽到謠言或未經官方確認的信息

examples.sentence: I heard [through the grapevine] that they are moving.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我聽說他們要搬家了。

examples.sentence: She found out [through the grapevine] about the promotion.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她通過聽到的消息得知了晉升的消息。

examples.sentence: They say you can always hear things [through the grapevine].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們說你總是可以聽到一些消息。

word: home is where the heart is

meanings.meaning_en_US: Home is defined by the people we love and care about.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 家是由我們愛和關心的人定義的

examples.sentence: For her, [home is where the heart is].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 對她來說，家是由愛的人和事物組成的。
others: a location marked on a map

examples.sentence: They say that [home is where the heart is], not about possessions.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們說「家就是心之所在」，而不是財物。

examples.sentence: He feels that [home is where the heart is] while being with family.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在與家人一起時，他感到「家就是心之所在」。

word: honesty is the best policy

meanings.meaning_en_US: Being truthful is the best way to handle situations.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 誠實是處理事情的最佳方式

examples.sentence: He believes that [honesty is the best policy] in life.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他認為「誠實是處理事情的最佳方式」。

examples.sentence: In business, [honesty is the best policy] for long-term success.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在商業中，「誠實是處理事情的最佳方式」是為了長期成功。

examples.sentence: Remember, [honesty is the best policy] in all dealings.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 記住，在所有交易中，「誠實是處理事情的最佳方式」。
